{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[567 BC]] &ndash; [[Servius Tullius]], the king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates a [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for his [[victory]] over the [[Etruscans]].
*[[240 BC]] &ndash; First recorded [[perihelion]] passage of [[Halley's Comet]].
*[[1085]] &ndash; [[Alfonso VI of Castile]] takes [[Toledo, Spain]], back from the [[Moors]].
*[[1420]] &ndash; [[Henry the Navigator]] is appointed [[governor]] of the [[Order of Christ (Portugal)|Order of Christ]].
*[[1521]] &ndash; The [[Diet of Worms]] ends when [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor]], issues the [[Edict of Worms]], declaring [[Martin Luther]] an [[outlaw]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Ming Dynasty|Ming]] general [[Wu Sangui]] forms an alliance with the invading [[Manchus]] and opens the gates of the [[Great Wall of China]] at [[Shanhai Pass|Shanhaiguan]] pass, letting the Manchus through towards the capital [[Beijing]].
*[[1659]] &ndash; [[Richard Cromwell]] resigns as [[Lord Protector]] of [[England]] following the [[wikt:restoration|restoration]] of the [[Long Parliament]], beginning a second brief period of the [[republicanism|republican]] [[government]] called the [[Commonwealth of England]].
*[[1738]] &ndash; A [[treaty]] between [[Pennsylvania]] and [[Maryland]] ends the [[Cresap's War|Conojocular War]] with settlement of a [[territorial dispute|boundary dispute]] and exchange of [[prisoner of war|prisoners]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Irish Rebellion of 1798|United Irishmen Rebellion]]: The [[Carnew massacre]], [[Massacre of Dunlavin Green|Dunlavin massacre]] and [[Battle of Carlow|Carlow massacre]] take place.
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Chuquisaca Revolution]]: a group of [[Patriot (Spanish American Revolution)|patriots]] in Chuquisaca (modern day [[Sucre]]) [[revolt]] against the [[Spanish Empire]], starting the [[South American Wars of Independence]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[May Revolution]]: citizens of [[Buenos Aires]] expel [[Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata|Viceroy]] [[Baltasar Hidalgo de Cisneros]] during the ''[[May Revolution#May Week|May week]]'', starting the [[Argentine War of Independence]].
*[[1819]] &ndash; The [[Argentine Constitution of 1819]] is [[Promulgation|promulgated]].
*[[1833]] &ndash; The [[Chilean Constitution of 1833]] is promulgated.
*[[1837]] &ndash; The [[Rebellions of 1837|Rebels]] of [[Lower Canada]] ([[Quebec]]) rebel against the [[United Kingdom|British]] for [[Political freedom|freedom]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; In [[Mobile, Alabama]], 300 are killed when an [[Mobile magazine explosion|ordnance depot explodes]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[Gilbert and Sullivan]]'s [[comic opera]] ''[[H.M.S. Pinafore]]'' opens at the [[Opera Comique]] in [[London]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; The playwright, poet, and novelist [[Oscar Wilde]] is convicted of "committing acts of [[Labouchere Amendment|gross indecency]] with [[Homosexuality|other male persons]]" and sentenced to serve two years in prison.
*  1895   &ndash; The [[Republic of Formosa]] is formed, with [[Tang Ching-sung]] as its [[List of rulers of Taiwan#Republic of Formosa .281895.29|president]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The United Kingdom's [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] passes [[Home Rule Act 1914|the Home Rule Act]] for [[devolution]] in [[Ireland]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Scopes Trial]]: [[John T. Scopes]] is indicted for teaching [[Charles Darwin]]'s theory of [[evolution]] in Tennessee.
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Sholom Schwartzbard]] assassinates [[Symon Petliura]], the head of the government of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]], which is in [[exile|government-in-exile]] in [[Paris]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Jesse Owens]] of [[Ohio State University]] breaks three world records and ties a fourth at the [[Big Ten Conference]] [[Track and field|Track and Field]] Championships in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; The [[Remington Rand strike of 1936–1937|Remington Rand strike]], led by the [[American Federation of Labor]], begins.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: The bombing of [[Alicante]] takes place, with 313 deaths.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The German [[2nd Panzer Division (Wehrmacht)|2nd Panzer Division]] captures the port of [[Boulogne-sur-Mer]]; the surrender of the last French and British troops marks the end of the [[Battle of Boulogne (1940)|Battle of Boulogne]]
*[[1946]] &ndash; The parliament of [[Jordan|Transjordan]] makes [[Abdullah I of Jordan]] their Emir.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Public Transport]]: Green Hornet disaster. A [[Chicago Surface Lines]] streetcar crashes into a fuel truck, killing 33.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Nuclear testing]]: At the [[Nevada Test Site]], the [[United States]] conduct their first and only [[nuclear artillery]] test.
*  1953   &ndash; The first [[List of public-access TV stations in the United States|public television station]] in the United States officially begins broadcasting as [[KUHT]] from the campus of the [[University of Houston]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; In the United States, a night-time [[Fujita scale|F5]] [[tornado]] strikes the small city of [[Udall, Kansas]], killing 80 and injuring 273. It is the deadliest tornado to ever occur in the state and the 23rd deadliest in the U.S.
*  1955   &ndash; First ascent of [[Kangchenjunga]] (8,586 m.), the third-highest mountain in the world, by a British expedition led by [[Charles Evans (mountaineer)|Charles Evans]]. [[Joe Brown (climber)|Joe Brown]] and [[George Band]] reached the summit on May 25, followed by Norman Hardie and [[Tony Streather]] the next day.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: The [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[John F. Kennedy]] announces before a special joint session of the [[United States Congress|Congress]] his goal to initiate a project to put a "man on the [[Moon]]" before the end of the decade.
*[[1961]] &ndash; The biggest fire in [[Singapore]] history. The [[Bukit Ho Swee Fire]]
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Old Bay Line]], the last overnight [[steamboat]] service in the [[United States]], goes out of business.
*[[1963]] &ndash; In [[Addis Ababa]], [[Ethiopia]], the [[Organisation of African Unity]] is established.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Explorer program]]: ''[[Explorer 32]]'' launches.
*  1966   &ndash; The first prominent [[Big-character poster|dàzìbào]] during the [[Cultural Revolution]] in [[China]] is posted at [[Peking University]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Celtic F.C.]] from Glasgow, Scotland, becomes the first ever Northern European team to win the [[1967 European Cup Final|European Cup]]; with previous winners being from [[Spain]], [[Italy]] and [[Portugal]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Gateway Arch]] Saint Louis Gateway Arch is dedicated.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[HNS Velos (D-16)]], while participating in a [[NATO]] exercise and in order to protest against the [[Greek military junta of 1967-1974|dictatorship in Greece]], anchored at [[Fiumicino]], [[Italy]], refusing to return to Greece.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Star Wars]] (retitled ''Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope'' in 1981) is released in theaters, inspiring the [[Jediism]] religion and [[Geek Pride Day]] holiday.
*  1977   &ndash; [[China|Chinese]] government removes a decade old ban on [[William Shakespeare]]'s work, effectively ending the [[Cultural Revolution]] started in 1966.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[American Airlines Flight 191]]: In [[Chicago]], a [[McDonnell Douglas DC-10]] crashes during takeoff at [[O'Hare International Airport]] killing all 271 on board and two people on the ground.
*  1979   &ndash; [[Etan Patz]], who is six years old, disappears from the street just two blocks away from his home in [[New York City]], prompting an international search for the child, and causing the U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] to designate May 25 as [[National Missing Children's Day]] (in 1983).
*[[1981]] &ndash; In [[Riyadh]], the [[Gulf Cooperation Council]] is created between [[Bahrain]], [[Kuwait]], [[Oman]], [[Qatar]], [[Saudi Arabia]] and the [[United Arab Emirates]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[HMS Coventry (D118)|HMS ''Coventry'']] is sunk during the [[Falklands War]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Bangladesh]] is hit by a [[tropical cyclone]] and [[storm surge]], which kills approximately 10,000 people.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Hands Across America]] takes place.
*[[1997]] &ndash; A military [[coup]] in [[Sierra Leone]] replaces President [[Ahmad Tejan Kabbah]] with Major [[Johnny Paul Koromah]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[United States House of Representatives]] releases the ''[[Cox Report]]'' which details the [[People's Republic of China]]'s nuclear espionage against the U.S. over the prior two decades.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Liberation Day (Lebanon)|Liberation Day of Lebanon]]. [[Israel]] withdraws its army from most of the [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] territory after 22 years of its first [[Operation Litani|invasion in 1978]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Erik Weihenmayer]], 32 years old, of [[Boulder, Colorado]], becomes the first blind person to reach the summit of [[Mount Everest]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[China Airlines Flight 611]] disintegrates in mid-air and crashes into the [[Taiwan Strait]]. All 225 people on board are killed.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s ''[[Phoenix (spacecraft)|Phoenix]]'' [[lander (spacecraft)|lander]] lands in [[Green Valley (Mars)|Green Valley]] region of [[Mars]] to search for environments suitable for water and [[Life on Mars|microbial life]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[North Korea]] allegedly tests [[2009 North Korean nuclear test|its second nuclear device]]. Following the nuclear test, Pyongyang also conducted several missile tests building tensions in the international community.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Oprah Winfrey]] airs her last show, ending her twenty-five-year run of ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]''.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[Dragon spacecraft]] became the [[COTS Demo Flight 2|first commercial spacecraft]] to successfully rendezvous with the [[International Space Station]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; Suspected [[Naxalite|Maoist rebels]] kill at least 28 people and injure 32 others in [[2013 Naxal attack in Darbha valley|an attack]] on a convoy of [[Indian National Congress]] politicians in [[Chhattisgarh]], [[India]].
